reporting-org.narrative: Flemish Interuniversity Council for University Development Cooperation (VLIR-UOS)
Vlaamse Interuniversitaire Raad voor Universitaire Ontwikkelingssamenwerking (VLIR-UOS)

description.narrative: After nearly 20 years of successful cooperation, Cuba assured itself a special place in the VLIR-UOS portfolio as one of top countries. Cuba will have the 2nd highest indicative country budget in the FYP. VLIR-UOS supports interventions that strengthen higher education, research and extension in various domains and with partners in different regions of the country. All interventions frame within the VLIR-UOS Country Strategy for Cuba which is completely aligned with national development and higher education priorities. The strategy is translated into the following main themes: Food security & agricultural production, Environment, Socio-cultural and tourism development (incl. role of cultural heritage), Public health, ICT for development. The prioritised transversal themes are: ICT support and applications (incl. statistics for research and information management); Language (English) and communications; internationalisation, institutional strengthening and human resources and capacity building, doctoral programmes and research and innovation. The core of the 2017-2021 programme will be a long term IUC programme with Universidad de Oriente (Santiago de Cuba) focussing on the development of the Eastern region of Cuba and a national ICT for Development Network programme led by Universidad Central "Marta Abreu" de las Villas. Also 6 TEAM projects and 1 South Initiative projects are foreseen to start as of 2017. A number of new projects (TEAM, SI and JOINT) for Cuba will still be selected in the 2017-2021 period.

Centro de Estudiuos Ambientales de Cienfuegos

title.narrative: Cuban Higher Education Institutes have been empowered in their role as drivers of change by strengthening their threefold mission of research, education and extension (of new knowledge, applications and services) to society.
Number of persons reached by presentations (community related) or extension workshops through the support of the project
Number of new or substantially updated Master programmes developed (curriculum) through the support of the project
Number of training module packages developed through the support of the project
Number of articles published in national peer reviewed journals (through the support of the project)
Number of Master students graduated directly supported by the project, contributing to the objectives of the project
Number of articles published in international peer reviewed journals (through the support of the project)
Number of presentations (community related) or extension workshops organised through the support of the project
Number of new courses developed through the support of the project

Cuban Higher Education Institutes have been empowered in their role as drivers of change by strengthening their threefold mission of research, education and extension (of new knowledge, applications and services) to society (continued).
Number of students or staff enabled in the areas of D4D (e-learning, ICT backbone/tools/services, library and information services) e-learning development
Number of PhD students graduated directly supported by the project, contributing to the objectives of the project

Number of students or staff enabled in the areas of quality management (internal/external) (research & tech. Transfer policy, quality assurance, scientific writing, statistics for research, academic English, human resources management)
